intro: Tabernaemontana amblyblasta, commonly known as the fragrant star jasmine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of star-shaped, fragrant white flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its pleasant scent and visual appeal. Tabernaemontana amblyblasta prefers warm, humid climates and well-drained soil for optimal growth.
